paper_abstract: This paper presents a novel framework that synthesize Chinese sign language (CSL) animation on ubiquitous platform-independent devices with consideration of the self-adaptive rendering capability of the device display screen. The display resolution visibility (DRV) factor is introduced here as the measurement of the system's adaptability. Both the 3D virtual human model and sign animation scripts are simplified according to the DRV Factor of the ubiquitous device. Consequently, a real-time transmission scheme is proposed for sign language animation over a heterogeneous network. Simulations results show that these innovations significantly reduce the transmission bandwidth and work very well on the ubiquitous devices. Copyright (C) 2011 John Wiley & Sons, Ltd.
paper_title: Interactive sign language synthesis based on adaptive display resolution visibility for ubiquitous devices
